It was a few days after Inori had told us that\nAkane could lose her powers again.%K%P
We went about our lives like it wasn't even\na possibility.%K%P
'So she could lose her powers and become a spirit...'%K%P
I was lying in bed thinking.%K%P
Akane said she was okay, and was acting like she\ndidn't worry at all, but I couldn't help being\nanxious.%K%P
'She can do what she likes as an Aragami,\nbut still...'%K%P
Deep in her heart was her worry that she might cause\ntrouble with her Jinriki.%K%P
And so she continued to have some doubts\nabout her own true nature.%K%P
At the very least, we should try finding a way to use\nher power that wouldn't cause blackouts.%K%P
'There's got to be something--'%K%P
'A blackout?'%K%P
That was odd. Akane hadn't caused a blackout\nin a while.%K%P
Could something have happened?%K%P
I recalled what Inori had said.%K%P
'I'd better go find Akane.'%K%P
'Oh, Sho!'%K%P
I used my phone to light the way as I wandered the\nhalls, and Akane came running up to me.%K%P
'Akane! Are you okay?'%K%P
'Yeah, I'm fine!'%K%P
'Really? You're not feeling sick like you did\nbefore?'%K%P
'Not at all. I feel the same as always.'%K%P
When I got close, I could see she was telling\nthe truth.%K%P
'That's good. So, this blackout wasn't caused by\nyour Jinriki going berserk?'%K%P
'Nope. This one isn't my fault!'%K%P
'So it must just be a regular old blackout.'%K%P
I had been worried something had happened to\nher to cause it, but luckily she was okay.%K%P
But if she wasn't the cause I was suddenly worried\nabout the town itself.%K%P
'I'm going to go see if everything is all right.\nWill you wait here?'%K%P
'No, I'm going too.\nYou're not the only one worried!'%K%P
Clearly, Akane had the same idea as me.%K%P
'Okay, let's go. It's dark, watch your step.'%K%P
'Yeah, I noticed that. You be careful, too.'%K%P
We left Tsubaki and walked the darkened streets\nof Kannagi.%K%P
We noticed several things.%K%P
'This is pretty large-scale...'%K%P
No lights were on in any of the buildings\nwe could see.%K%P
This blackout was much more wide spread than any of\nthe ones Akane had caused.%K%P
The traffic lights were out, so there could even\nbe car accidents.%K%P
'Sho...'%K%P
Akane sensed my worry, and took my hand anxiously.%K%P
I squeezed back, hoping to reassure her.%K%P
'Let's head back to the apartments.\nMaika and Inori are probably worried, too.'%K%P
'Y-Yeah, you're right.'%K%P
I pulled Akane along, as she kept turning around to\nlook. We made it back to the apartments.%K%P
'Oh, there you are!'%K%P
When we came into the living room, Inori\ncame rushing up.%K%P
'Oh, I'm so glad.\nWhen you didn't come out\nI got worried.'%K%P
'Seriously! Where did you guys run off to?'%K%P
Should've checked in before we left.%K%P
We worried them both.%K%P
'Sorry. We went out to check on the town.'%K%P
'And how is it out there?'%K%P
'The whole town is dark, it's kind of crazy.'%K%P
We told them what we had seen.%K%P
'The whole town?\nI had no idea it was so big...'%K%P
Maika and Inori were frowning at the news.%K%P
'I'm worried. What if there's been an accident?'%K%P
'What kind of accident?'%K%P
'There's probably some equipment trouble.'%K%P
The three of them were talking closely,\ntroubled looks on their faces.%K%P
I figured we would get nowhere with all this\nheavy talk, so I opened my mouth.%K%P
'Things are a little chaotic right now, but I'm sure\nthey'll get it sorted out soon.'%K%P
Before, it had taken a while for the power to come\nback because of Akane's Jinriki.%K%P
But this time, since it was a natural occurrence,\nI doubted it would take very long to fix it.%K%P
'Do you think so?'%K%P
'Yeah. It won't get too out of hand.\nI mean, we've had tons of blackouts and\nit never got very bad.'%K%P
I said all this as lightly as possible, wanting to\nbreak the tension.%K%P
'Y-Yeah, I guess so. We shouldn't be so\npessimistic.'%K%P
'Right! We should just act like normal.\nI'm sure it'll come back on while we're\nall sitting here talking.'%K%P
Or so we thought...%K%P
'It's not back yet...'%K%P
Akane's muttering filled the darkened room.%K%P
It had been a while since the power went out,\nbut there was no sign of it coming back on.%K%P
In the light of the flashlight on the table,\nAkane and the others looked nervous.%K%P
'I'll see what I can find out.'%K%P
It really was taking a long time.%K%P
I took out my phone and looked up the\nblackout in Kannagi.%K%P
'Hmmm, let's see...'%K%P
I scanned the results.%K%P
'Currently, a wide spread blackout is\naffecting the area around Kannagi Town.'%K%P
'The cause of the outage is currently\nunder investigation, but there are no estimates on\nwhen power will return.'%K%P
So basically no one knew when they would\nget it fixed.%K%P
I told the girls what I had found.%K%P
'So, we just have to wait like this?'%K%P
'If this blackout continues for too long,\nwe're in trouble. The roads are going to\nbe a mess.'%K%P
'Indeed. It's a serious issue when city facilities\nshut down. Hospitals and such have emergency\ngenerators, but they can't last forever.'%K%P
'I hope that no one in Kannagi is harmed...'%K%P
The more we thought about it, the worse\nthe problem seemed.%K%P
Even though I'd seen the city myself, I never really\nthought a blackout was such a big deal.%K%P
Could we just sit by and let this go on?%K%P
'Hey... Do you think there's anything\nI can do?'%K%P
Akane said in a quiet, but strong voice.%K%P
'Akane?'%K%P
'I know my Jinriki isn't very useful.\nBut all these people who've been so nice\nto me are in trouble, and I can't ignore it.'%K%P
'I'm an Aragami, but still a goddess, right?\nSo isn't there something I can do?'%K%P
'Akane, I understand how you feel.'%K%P
'But I don't think there is anything our Jinriki\ncan do to help. Indeed, if we make a mistake,\nwe could make things considerably worse.'%K%P
'I know. I know all that, but still...'%K%P
Akane clenched her fists in frustration at\nbeing so powerless.%K%P
'Ah, the batteries...'%K%P
The flashlight flickered and went out,\nleaving the room in total darkness.%K%P
'It had been flickering for a while.'%K%P
'I'll go get some fresh batteries.'%K%P
'It's dark, be careful.'%K%P
'Yeah, I know.'%K%P
While Maika was out getting batteries, Akane\nreached toward the flashlight.%K%P
'*Sigh* If only I could use my Jinriki\nto charge batteries and stuff.\nI totally failed that one time.'%K%P
'Charge?'%K%P
Her words gave me an idea.%K%P
We had all thought that Akane's Jinriki could only\ncause power to go out.%K%P
But blackouts have a reason.%K%P
Could it be that Akane caused blackouts not by\nblocking electricity, but by absorbing it?%K%P
'Hey, Akane... Could you try using your Jinriki?'%K%P
'Huh? Why?'%K%P
'Do you have an idea, Sho?'%K%P
'Yeah. When we first met, Akane tried to use\nher Jinriki to charge my phone.'%K%P
'Yeah, but I messed it up.'%K%P
'That was probably because you didn't really\nwant to control it. But if you really could use\nit now, maybe you could end this blackout.'%K%P
'But...'%K%P
'You've changed since then, Akane.\nI know it'll work. I believe in you.'%K%P
'Right. okay, I guess\nI'll give it a try...\nAnd... Ugh!'%K%P
Akane took a deep breath and unleashed\nher power on the flashlight.'%K%P
'Agh!'%K%P
There was an instant of electric noise and\nthen the flashlight flickered back on.%K%P
'It...worked?'%K%P
'I-It looks like it.\nI've never done anything\nso precise before...'%K%P
'So what was that big flash just now? Huh?\nWhy is the flashlight back on?'%K%P
'Oh, well, actually...'%K%P
I told Maika about what Akane had done.%K%P
'Huh... So maybe Akane could get this\nblackout fixed using her power?'%K%P
'Yeah, maybe. I think she can really help.'%K%P
When I said that, Akane started to look embarrassed.%K%P
'Do you really think I should do this?'%K%P
'That just now might have been a coincidence.\nIf I mess this up, I might cause even\nmore trouble for everyone.'%K%P
'Akane, I believe your Jinriki can help people.'%K%P
'It's okay! I know you'll do it.\nYour Jinriki can protect us all.\nI believe it. So do it.'%K%P
I used my words to give her courage.%K%P
I truly believed that Akane's power could do more\nthan just cause problems.%K%P
'Sho... Right. I'll do it!'%K%P
Raising her face, she stood resolutely.%K%P
Once, a huge electric pylon had stood on\nthese grounds.%K%P
It had been removed when the grounds had\nbeen rebuilt, but there was still traces of\nit in the courtyard.%K%P
There was no better place for this electrical\ngoddess, Akane, to use her power.%K%P
Maika had gone to check on the shopping street,\nand Inori had gone to her boss,\nso right now we were alone.%K%P
'All ready?'%K%P
'Phew... Yes, I'm ready.\nAnytime is fine!'%K%P
'Right, let's start.'%K%P
Akane put her hand on the pylon's remains, closed\nher eyes then reopened them.%K%P
'Gah!'%K%P
This time, when Akane released her power there was a\nmuch brighter flash than before.%K%P
At the same time, the air was filled with an\noverwhelming power, like the embodiment\nof raw natural power.%K%P
'So this is what Akane can do?!'%K%P
Great cracking bolts of electricity illuminated the\ndarkness around Akane.%K%P
'I-It's no good! I can't control it!'%K%P
The electricity surrounding her danced wildly,\nignoring her attempts to control it.%K%P
If it went on like this, I could see she might\ntotally lose control.%K%P
Now that she'd actually taken hold of her power,\nI couldn't bear the thought of her failing now.%K%P
'You can't let that happen!'%K%P
I held her from behind, as if to support her.%K%P
'Sho?! No! You can't be here, it's too dangerous!'%K%P
'I trust you! It's okay! I know that your power\nis here to protect the people of Kannagi!'%K%P
I assured her, holding her body close.%K%P
'Don't hold back! Just do what you know you can!\nI know that you can do this!'%K%P
I couldn't do much, but I had more faith\nin Akane than anyone.%K%P
'Seriously... You're an idiot.\nBut since you're counting on me,\nI can't just give up...'%K%P
The tension seemed to melt from her body and\nthe anxious tone in her voice softened.%K%P
The electricity flying around Akane suddenly\ncame together and grew even brighter,\ngathering close to her.%K%P
'Watch, Sho. See how even an Aragami can help\npeople!'%K%P
When Akane called out to me, the light exploded.%K%P
'Gah!'%K%P
It was so bright I couldn't open my eyes for a while.%K%P
When it seemed the light had died down,\nI opened my eyes and saw that\nthe lights were on in Tsubaki.%K%P
'The power's back on...'%K%P
'Phew... I did it! Yeah!\nBut... Now I'm so tired...'%K%P
I grabbed the wobbling Akane and patted her head.%K%P
'Good job. Thank you.'%K%P
'Haha... I actually helped everyone, right?'%K%P
'Yes, it was beautiful, like a true goddess.'%K%P
'Oh, yeah... I am a goddess, aren't I?'%K%P
'I told you, didn't I?\nYour powers can help everyone.'%K%P
'Yeah... My Jinriki actually has meaning...'%K%P
As if checking her own power, Akane clenched\nher hands at her chest.%K%P
'This power can help people.\nEven as an Aragami,\nI can help people.'%K%P
Akane, murmuring in my arms, suddenly looked\nrelieved, as if a darkness had been\nlifted from her.%K%P
'Sho... It's okay for me to be an Aragami, right?'%K%P
'Of course it is. You're a wonderful goddess.\nYou should be proud of who you are.'%K%P
'Yeah, you're right! I can be an Aragami!'%K%P
'So I might still be a bother, but that's okay too!'%K%P
